relation: Great for these types of students
Up to this point, I have not felt threatened or unsafe.
The clubs are limited, but the clubs on campus do great things.
This college is great for any one who wants to further their education and save a buck while doing it.
Hinds Community College has talent shows, student teacher flag football, and much more. Community service is most important to me though. Serving others fills me with joy.
The campus I attend only has one little cafe and serves prepackaged food items.
I cannot accurately rate the dorms, because I live at home.
Hinds Community College courses keep me on my toes and challenge me on a daily basis. However, if the effort is put forward, success will occur. Professors want their students to excel.
Prospective students should keep a positive attitude. When you believe you cannot succeed, just remember you are not alone.
This community college is a great starting point for degree seeking students. I truly love my professors and small one on one classes. Hinds Community College is a quality college.
pageTitle: Hinds Community College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {100712=I attended Hinds in the fall and spring for 2011-2012. It was beautiful and the teachers we're great. I transfer to a different school, and now I can't wait to be back at Hinds!, 40497=I attend Hinds CC in Pearl, MS, and I started in 2009 after high school. It was great in 2009, but now they are changing a lot about the college making you do unnecessary work that in my opinion isn't helping me. I dislike what they are doing with this college, and the teachers get off subject more than they should., 161422=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: Bang for the buck If you're looking to save money, I can't think of better advice than to tell you to go to Hinds. I got money back. Am enjoying being here The student body is fairly friendly, the faculty is usually amazing, but it's not a large university and there is no party scene. A lot of people commute, and the campus is dead on the weekends. Am learning a lot Depending on what classes [topic, honors/nonhonors, specific teachers], there's no reason to down the curriculum just because it's a bargain school. The work is just as solid as a large university. Login to rate or flag the reviews Clarissa from Vicksburg, MS 05/17/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 5 out of 5 people found this review useful. 3 of 43 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Hinds is really great for
